meanings.definition: To put a new lining inside (something)
meanings.sent1: I need to reline my jacket with a warmer material for winter.
meanings.sent2: The tailor will reline my coat to make it look brand new.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tore the lining of my bag, so I have to reline it now.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reline her curtains with a colorful fabric to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to reline the brake pads to ensure the car stopped smoothly.

meanings.definition: To replace the lining of (a garment)
meanings.sent1: After years of wear, it's time to reline my favorite jacket.
meanings.sent2: The seamstress will reline the dress to fix the torn fabric inside.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would have to reline my pants, but the fabric wore out quickly.
meanings.sent4: The old coat was relined with a soft material, making it cozy to wear.
meanings.sent5: She had to reline her purse after the lining ripped during a busy day.
